206522-d-03-08-08-SOO.Narrative: AT APPROXIMATELY 1610 HOURS ON 3/11/08 G47 ENGINEER INFORMED YARD MANAGER THAT HIS CREW ARRIVED AT NEWLYWED FOODS & FOUND THE BUMPING POST ON THE LEAD TRACK WAS DAMAGED & RAIL CAR ADMX 50015 WAS AGAINST IT, BUT NOT DAMAGED. BUMPING POST WAS EXAMINED  & FOUND THE CEMENT BED IN WHICH IT WAS ENCASED WAS CRUMBLED & BROKEN. SEVERAL BOLTS WERE SHEARED & METAL BENT. AFTER INTERVIEWING G47 CREW FROM 3/8/08, THEY STATED THEY WERE HAVING A DIFFICULT TIME COUPLING TO THE EQUIPMENT DUE TO CARS BEING LEFT ONCURVATURE AND APPEARS TO BE WHEN THIS INCIDENT OCCURRED. CAUSE M599  - OTHER MISC CAUSES DEVELOP ANOTHER PROCESS TO SPOT CARS WHERE THEY ARE TO BE PLACED FURTHER AWAY FROM BUMPING POST WHEN SPOTTINGDUE TO CURVATURE CAUSING DIFFICULTY.

132008-d-03-31-08-SLRG.Narrative: WE HAD A DERAILMENT AT MILEPOST 199.5 ON 12-3-07.  THE REPAIRS WERE NOT COMPLETED BEFORE THE TRACK WAS PUT BACK INTO SERVICE AGAINST THE OBJECTION OF THE ROADMASTER AND TRACK FOREMAN.  THERE WAS NOT BALLAST PUT INTO THE AFFECTED TRACK.  IT WAS NOT TAMPED AND THERE WERE STILL TIES THAT NEEDED TO BE REPLACED.  WINTER FROZE THE ROADBED SOLID AND WE SUCCESSFULLY OPERATED TRAINS THROUGH THE DERAILMENTSITE THROUGH THE WINTER.  THE ROADBED THAWED OUT.  CROSS LEVEL SUFFERED AND THE TIES STARTED PUMPINGQUITE BADLY.  MARCH 31, 2008 WE DERAILED AT THE SAME SPOT DUE TO CORSSLEVEL, LACK OF BALLAST, AND UNTAMPED TRACK.

205772-d-03-17-08-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 387-231 WAS WORKING AT HOFFMAN, MN (INDUSTRY OWNED/MAINTAINED TRACK) PUTTING TOGETHER 100 LOADS OF CORN & SOYBEANS ON THE HOUSE TRACKS. THE CREW DEPARTED GLENWOOD LITE POWER & AFTER ARRIVING HOFFMAN FIRST COUPLED TO 30 CARS ON THE NORTH HOUSE TRACK, THEN PULLED WEST TO CLEAR THE NORTH/SOUTH HOUSE TRACK SWITCH SO THEY COULD SHOVE BACK TO LIFT 40 CARS ON THE SOUTH HOUSE TRACK. AFTER THE 70 CARS WERE COUPLED TOGETHER, THE CONDUCTOR INSTRUCTED THE ENGINEER TO AGAIN PULL WEST IN ORDER FOR HIM TO ENTRAIN THE REAR CAR & SHOVE BACK EAST TO THE BALANCE OF THEIR TRAIN FURTHER DOWN ON THE SOUTH HOUSE TRACK. AFTER PULLING ABOUT 10 CAR LENGTHS, THE TRAIN LOST IT'S AIR & THE CONDUCTOR WALKED UP TO DISCOVER 5 CARS HAD DERAILED - ALL CARS REMAINED UPRIGHT. THERE WAS ABOUT 400' OF 3RD PARTY TRACK DAMAGE.

D080318-d-03-17-08-LSRC.Narrative: JOB # Z144 LOCOMOTIVE BNSF 9643/BNSF/ 5668/CSXT 8092/ WHILE PASSING THROUGH SLOW ORDER OVER WASHINGTON AVE THE MOTION OF THE TRAIN BECAME SLIGHTLY JERKY TUGGING AT TIME LOCOMOTIVES.  CURRENTLY IN NOTCH 1 INCREASE TO NOTCH 2 THEN TO 3, BUT THE MOVEMENT SLOWED FROM IT'S CURRENT 4.5 SPEED DOWN TO 3.5.ENGINEER DECREASED THE THROTTLE NOTCH KEEPING THE DRAFT THE SAME.  AFTER REDUCING POWER THE SPEED OF THE TRAIN RAPIDLY DECREASED.  HE CLOSED THE THROTTLE AND APPLIED MINIMUM SERVICE STOPPING THE TRAIN.  ENGINEER TRIED ONE MORE TIME TO GET THE TRAIN MOVING WOULD NOT MOVE CLOSED THE THROTTLE AND APPLIED FULL SERVICE.  CONDUCTOR INSPECTED THE TRAIN AND FOUND 9 CARS ON THE GROUND.  CARS DERAILED FSTX9082, FSTX 5663, FSTX 5605, FSTX 2056, FSTX 2081, FSTX 2036, FSTX 2095, FSTX 7139, FSTX 2246, ENGINEER AND CONDUCTOR STATED PRIMARY CAUSE AS TRACK ROADBED AND STRUCTURE. TRACKMAN REPORT FILLED OUT.RECORDER INFORMATION ON FILE.

200802-d-03-02-08-EWG.Contributing Accident Cause: Train outside yard limits in non block territory, excessive speed
200802-d-03-02-08-EWG.Narrative: PLEASE SEE ATTACHED REPORTS.  NO DRUG/ALCOHOL INVOLVEMENT ASSOCIATED WITH THIS DERAILMENT.  CONTRIBUTING CAUSE WAS SLIGHTLY EXCESSING SPEED COUPLE WITH SPOT ROADBED CAUSING A " ROCK AND ROLL" SITUATION.  AT 1650, 03/02/08, T WAS OPERATING EASTBOUND AT WILBUR WITH 2 UNITS (MRL 260, NIWX 8925) AND 47X0, 6157 TONS, 2867 FT., COMING INTO THE TOWN AT 10 MPH AT TIME 74.7 MP.  AS I CAME THRU THE TOWN, IKEPT MY SPEED AT 10 MPH UNTIL THE HEAD END OF THE TRAIN WAS BY THE LAST ROAD CROSSING (MP 74.2.) ATTHAT TIME, I BEGAN TO OPEN UP ON THE THROTTLE (I WAS RUNNING IN #5 THROTTLE), WORKING BACK TO #8 THROTTLE TO CLIMB THE RULING GRADE EASTBOUND OUT OF WILBUR.  BY THE TIME I WAS IN #8 THROTTLE, THE ENGINES AND THE FIRST 1/2 OF THE TRAIN HAD TURNED UP THE HILL, AND I WAS OPERATING ABOUT 15 MPH, ABOUT THE TIME I BEGAN TO LOSE SPEED, THE REAR END MARKED CHURPED 3 TIMES AND WENT TO "00".  AS I BEGAN TOWONDER WHAT HAD HAPPENED, THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY, COMING TO A QUICK STOP ON THE SIDE OF THE HILL.  CONDUCTOR WAS IN HIS VEHICLE AT THE LAST CROSSING IN TOWN, OBSERVING THE TRAIN PASSING BY.  ICALLED CONDUCTOR AND TOLD HIM TO DRIVE TOWARD THE REAR TO INSPECT AND SEE WHAT HE FINDS.  WHEN CONDUCTOR REACHED THE REAR (74.5), HE FOUND THE REAR CAR TURNED OVER ON IT'S SOUTH SIDE, 2 CALL LENGTHS EAST OF THE WEST SWITCH OF THE SOUTH TRACK AT WILBUR.  THE CAR BNSF 449098, WAS ON IT'S SOUTH SIDE, GRAIN DUMPING OUT THE TOP HATCHED ONTO THE SURROUNDING GROUND.  BOTH TRUCKS ON EACH  END WERE IN PIEC
